newsitem.title: USA: Liberty Financial registers for share offer.
newsitem.headline: Liberty Financial registers for share offer.

text.p: Liberty Financial Cos Inc on Tuesday said it filed a registration statement for a secondary public offering of 2.5 million shares of common stock to be sold by an indirect subsidiary of the company and certain other stockholders.
Managing underwriters for the offering are Merrill Lynch & Co Inc, Goldman, Sachs & Co, PaineWebber Group Inc and Fox-Pitt, Kelton, Inc.
The Liberty Mutual subsidiary granted to the underwriters a 30-day option to purchase up to 375,000 additional shares of common stock solely to cover overallotments.
Liberty Financial's stock were trading at 49-3/4 early Tuesday afternoon, down $1-1/4.
Currently, the Liberty Mutual subsidiary owns about 81.2 percent of the common stock of Liberty Financial and about 80.3 percent of the voting power of its voting stock.
Following the offering, the Liberty Mutual subsidiary will continue to own about 74.5 percent of the common stock and about 73.6 percent of the voting power of its voting stock.

Liberty Financial is an integrated financial management organization with more than $47 billion in assets in an array of fixed, variable and indexed annuities, private and institutional accounts, and mutual funds.
